violationsByInspectionidList.violationDescription:
Each HANDWASHING SINK or group of adjacent HANDWASHING SINKS shall be provided with:
(A) Individual, disposable towels; (Pf)
(B) A continuous towel system that supplies the user with a clean towel;(Pf) or 
(C) A heated-air hand drying device.(Pf)
(D) A hand drying device that employs an air-knife system that delivers high velocity pressurized air at ambient temperatures.(Pf)

Except otherwise approved, and except for antislip floor coverings or applications may be used for safety reasons, floors, floor coverings, walls, wall coverings, and ceilings shall be designed, constructed, and installed so they are SMOOTH and EASILY CLEANABLE.
violationsByInspectionidList.problemDescription: Not constructed, designed, installed to be

violationsByInspectionidList.violationDescription:
(A) PHYSICAL FACILITIES shall be cleaned as often as necessary to keep them clean.
(B) Except spill cleanup, cleaning shall be done during periods when the least amount of FOOD is exposed such as after closing.
NonFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES of EQUIPMENT shall be cleaned at a frequency necessary to preclude accumulation of soil residues.
NonFOOD-CONTACT SURFACES of EQUIPMENT shall be cleaned at a frequency necessary to preclude accumulation of soil residues.
Cleaned EQUIPMENT and UTENSILS, laundered LINENS, and SINGLE-SERVICE and SINGLE-USE ARTICLES shall be stored in an approved manner and location.

(A) PHYSICAL FACILITIES shall be cleaned as often as necessary to keep them clean.
(B) Except spill cleanup, cleaning shall be done during periods when the least amount of FOOD is exposed such as after closing.

(A) The FOOD-CONTACT SURFACES of cooking and baking EQUIPMENT shall be cleaned at least every 24 hours. This section does not apply to hot oil cooking and filtering EQUIPMENT if it is cleaned as specified in Subparagraph 4-602.11(D)(6).   
(B) The cavities and door seals of microwave ovens shall be cleaned at least every 24 hours by using the manufacturer's recommended cleaning procedure.
violationsByInspectionidList.itemDescription: Microwave oven door seals and cavities

violationsByInspectionidList.violationDescription:
(A) PHYSICAL FACILITIES shall be cleaned as often as necessary to keep them clean.
(B) Except spill cleanup, cleaning shall be done during periods when the least amount of FOOD is exposed such as after closing.

Exhaust ventilation hood systems in FOOD preparation and WAREWASHING areas including components such as hoods, fans, guards, and ducting shall be designed to prevent grease or condensation from draining or dripping onto FOOD, EQUIPMENT, UTENSILS, LINENS, and SINGLE-SERVICE and SINGLE-USE ARTICLES.
violationsByInspectionidList.problemDescription: Designed to allow grease or condensation from draining/dripping onto

violationsByInspectionidList.violationDescription: After use, mops shall be placed in a position that allows them to air-dry without soiling walls, EQUIPMENT, or supplies.

(A) The FOOD-CONTACT SURFACES of cooking and baking EQUIPMENT shall be cleaned at least every 24 hours. This section does not apply to hot oil cooking and filtering EQUIPMENT if it is cleaned as specified in Subparagraph 4-602.11(D)(6).   
(B) The cavities and door seals of microwave ovens shall be cleaned at least every 24 hours by using the manufacturer's recommended cleaning procedure.
